medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of nausea and abdominal pain started after cataract surgery, about 5 days prior to presentation. The pain is episodic, lasting minutes, and localizes to bilateral lower quadrants radiating above the umbilicus. The pain intensity has prevented her from sleeping at night. Passing gas improves the pain, while feeling bloated worsens it. No bowel movement in 3 days, which is typical for her. Tried peptobismal without relief. No worsening with eating or drinking, and despite nausea, she denies vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of transient ischemic attacks (TIAs), suspected right cerebellar stroke, neuropathy, hypertension, labile hypercholesterolemia, coronary artery disease status post stenting, systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), anemia, Schambergâ€™s disease, multiple pelvic surgeries, history of immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), chronic kidney disease stage IV, history of bilateral renal artery stents for renal artery stenosis, cataract surgery on right eye, history of multiple abdominal surgeries with removal of benign tumor and ovarian growths, cervical spondylosis.
medical_history.family_history: Father had myocardial infarction, mother had myocardial infarction and stroke, brother had colon cancer.
